ca670f50-e2f3-412d-aa40-ed6dea5686bb.description: This Award is for a retirement living development where no less than 50 units or dwellings have been completed in a new or refurbished development.
ca670f50-e2f3-412d-aa40-ed6dea5686bb.name: National Retirement Living Awards 2021 - Finalist - FMSA Architecture Award for Best Retirement Living Development

issuer.summary: issued by Property Council of Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Member of the Property Council of Australia
Submitted an entry for the 2021 National Retirement Living Awards - FMSA Architecture Award for Best Retirement Living Development.

Eligible entrants are developments or refurbishments that have been completed in the previous five years, have been operating for at least one year as at 31 December 2020 and have not previously won the Award.
Demonstrated that the development has met or exceeded financial outcomes.
The development displays innovation in the project concept and in overcoming site or development complexities.
The development demonstrates tangible economic, environmental and social dividends.
The development exhibits a high quality of architectural design; is compatible with surrounding land uses and contributed to the success of the development project.
The development provides for adaptability to building technology changes and user demands.
The development has a high level of facilities and a proven high satisfaction level of all users through a variety of stakeholders.
The development is considered a success by the property marketplace through testimonials from a variety of stakeholders.
The nominated project aligns with the Liveable Housing Australia Design Guidelines.
The nominated project aligns with the Property Council’s Best Practice Principles for Seniors Community Design.

cd0dfc91-9646-4a0d-95e0-8bf3badd2d67.description: This award recognises outstanding young professionals (35 years or under) in the retirement living industry who demonstrate excellence through their leadership, technical skills and capacity to innovate. A nominee can work for a retirement village owner/operator or service provider to the industry, and can be involved in any area, including but not limited to sales, operations, design, marketing or engineering.
cd0dfc91-9646-4a0d-95e0-8bf3badd2d67.name: National Retirement Living Awards 2021 - Finalist - Ingenia Communities Award for Future Retirement Living Leader

issuer.summary: issued by Property Council of Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Member of the Property Council of Australia
Submitted an entry for the 2021 National Retirement Living Awards - Ingenia Communities Award for Future Retirement Living Leader
The award is open to young professionals in the retirement living industry aged 35 or under as of 30 June 2021.
Demonstrated how the nominee has contributed to or led a significant project for the benefit of the sector.
Displayed innovation in the execution of an idea or project, either internally or externally.
Demonstrated instances where the nominee went beyond their normal skillset or job description and applied both skills and enthusiasm to deliver a positive outcome.
Demonstrate their skills development during their current role and how they’ve applied those skills for a practical purpose.
Demonstrated ability to develop plans to remedy situations and overcome challenges within their role.

b8375b6c-1f3e-4954-b2fd-162d514c956d.description: The Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year recognises a Retirement Village or Retirement Community Manager who creates a successful, happy and harmonious village environment through their exceptional leadership and personal commitment to residents. Entries were shortlisted as finalists for reach region (NSW/ACT, SA/NT, VIC/TAS, WA and QLD).
b8375b6c-1f3e-4954-b2fd-162d514c956d.name: National Retirement Living Awards 2021 - NSW/ACT Regional Finalist - Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year

issuer.summary: issued by Property Council of Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Member of the Property Council of Australia
Submitted an entry for the 2021 National Retirement Living Awards - Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year.
Demonstrated excellence in operations through the administration of business practices to create maximum efficiency within their organisation.

Demonstrated excellence in governance and compliance through the understanding, meeting or exceeding of the rules, industry standards and corporate policies required by legislation, self-regulation, and regulators/government agencies.
Demonstrated excellence in self-management through the ability to regulate emotions, thoughts, and behaviours to deliver organisational outputs effectively in different situations.

Demonstrate excellence in change and innovation through the ability to determine different approaches to prepare, support and help individuals, teams, and organisations in making change or thinking of new ways to deliver products, goods and services.

Demonstrated excellence in community engagement through the process of anticipating and having a plan to manage the likely range of expectations of any person or any formal or informal group of people who may have an interest in the village or will be affected by operating deliverables or outputs.
Demonstrated excellence in population wellness through the overall understanding of appropriate health objectives of varying groups or subgroups of residents as they age.

2353aaab-036e-4d24-8715-434694181593.description: The Imagine Projects Award for Salesperson of the Year recognises a Salesperson who achieves outstanding results in leading and driving sales of retirement living units/apartments (independent and/or ‘care’ or ‘serviced’ apartments) at one or more retirement villages. The national winner was chosen amongst the regional winners for the Imagine Projects Award for Salesperson of the Year award.
2353aaab-036e-4d24-8715-434694181593.name: National Retirement Living Awards 2021 - National Winner - Imagine Projects Award for Salesperson of the Year

issuer.summary: issued by Property Council of Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Member of the Property Council of Australia
Regional Winner of the 2021 National Retirement Living Awards - Imagine Projects Award for Salesperson of the Year award.

Demonstrated an appropriate and rewarding prospective resident experience - including a thorough understanding of the retirement village value proposition, the product/DMF options and financial implications, an enjoyable and informed/responsive experience for prospective residents and their families/carers.
Demonstrated the achievement of excellent sales.
Demonstrated excellence in community and resident engagement.
Demonstrated leadership, professional development and collaboration skills. Going ‘above and beyond’ to provide excellence in maintaining and strengthening relationships with relevant stakeholders.

138a0e92-7d40-49ca-8809-1faa7f57ac9d.description: The Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year recognises a Retirement Village or Retirement Community Manager who creates a successful, happy and harmonious village environment through their exceptional leadership and personal commitment to residents. The national winner was chosen amongst the regional winners for the Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year.
138a0e92-7d40-49ca-8809-1faa7f57ac9d.name: National Retirement Living Awards 2021 - National Winner - Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year

issuer.summary: issued by Property Council of Australia

badge_template_activities.title: Member of the Property Council of Australia
Regional Winner of the 2021 National Retirement Living Awards - Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year.
Demonstrated excellence in operations through the administration of business practices to create maximum efficiency within their organisation.

Demonstrated excellence in governance and compliance through the understanding, meeting or exceeding of the rules, industry standards and corporate policies required by legislation, self-regulation, and regulators/government agencies.
Demonstrated excellence in self-management through the ability to regulate emotions, thoughts, and behaviours to deliver organisational outputs effectively in different situations.

Demonstrate excellence in change and innovation through the ability to determine different approaches to prepare, support and help individuals, teams, and organisations in making change or thinking of new ways to deliver products, goods and services.

Demonstrated excellence in community engagement through the process of anticipating and having a plan to manage the likely range of expectations of any person or any formal or informal group of people who may have an interest in the village or will be affected by operating deliverables or outputs.
Demonstrated excellence in population wellness through the overall understanding of appropriate health objectives of varying groups or subgroups of residents as they age.

Demonstrated an appropriate and rewarding prospective resident experience - including a thorough understanding of the retirement village value proposition, the product/DMF options and financial implications, an enjoyable and informed/responsive experience for prospective residents and their families/carers.

bde1605b-a5de-4a5d-8381-167a15aa61e8.description: The Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year recognises a Retirement Village or Retirement Community Manager who creates a successful, happy and harmonious village environment through their exceptional leadership and personal commitment to residents. The award is divided into regions (NSW/ACT, SA/NT, VIC/TAS, WA and QLD) with the regional winners making up the five national finalists.
bde1605b-a5de-4a5d-8381-167a15aa61e8.name: National Retirement Living Awards 2021 - NSW/ACT Regional Winner - Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year

badge_template_activities.title: Member of the Property Council of Australia
Shortlisted as a NSW/ACT Regional Finalist in the 2021 National Retirement Living Awards - Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year.
Demonstrated excellence in operations through the administration of business practices to create maximum efficiency within their organisation.

Demonstrated excellence in governance and compliance through the understanding, meeting or exceeding of the rules, industry standards and corporate policies required by legislation, self-regulation, and regulators/government agencies.
Demonstrated excellence in self-management through the ability to regulate emotions, thoughts, and behaviours to deliver organisational outputs effectively in different situations.

Demonstrate excellence in change and innovation through the ability to determine different approaches to prepare, support and help individuals, teams, and organisations in making change or thinking of new ways to deliver products, goods and services.

Demonstrated excellence in community engagement through the process of anticipating and having a plan to manage the likely range of expectations of any person or any formal or informal group of people who may have an interest in the village or will be affected by operating deliverables or outputs.
Demonstrated excellence in population wellness through the overall understanding of appropriate health objectives of varying groups or subgroups of residents as they age.

72c54db2-bb5d-4431-b6aa-b4eedaf2192d.name: National Retirement Living Awards 2021 - Winner - Blueforce Award for Best Refurbishment

Shortlisted as a Finalist in the 2021 National Retirement Living Awards - Blueforce Award for Best Refurbishment.
Eligible entrants will be projects that have been completed in the previous five years, have been operating for at least one year as of 31 December 2020 and have not previously won the Award.

Demonstrated excellence in refurbishment through examples such as highlighting great design practice, choice of products or new construction procedures which provide minimal disruption and great results for residents and staff, resident satisfaction and sales enquiries/occupancy.
The refurbishment demonstrates tangible economic, environmental and social dividends.
The refurbishment delivered proven benefits and had a positive impact on resident satisfaction.
A proven success by the retirement living industry through testimonials from a variety of stakeholders.
The nominated project aligns with the Liveable Housing Australia Design Guidelines.

Demonstrated excellence in operations through the administration of business practices to create maximum efficiency within their organisation.

Demonstrated excellence in governance and compliance through the understanding, meeting or exceeding of the rules, industry standards and corporate policies required by legislation, self-regulation, and regulators/government agencies.
Demonstrated excellence in self-management through the ability to regulate emotions, thoughts, and behaviours to deliver organisational outputs effectively in different situations.

Demonstrate excellence in change and innovation through the ability to determine different approaches to prepare, support and help individuals, teams, and organisations in making change or thinking of new ways to deliver products, goods and services.

Demonstrated excellence in community engagement through the process of anticipating and having a plan to manage the likely range of expectations of any person or any formal or informal group of people who may have an interest in the village or will be affected by operating deliverables or outputs.
Demonstrated excellence in population wellness through the overall understanding of appropriate health objectives of varying groups or subgroups of residents as they age.

9093d79e-be13-4de9-b5f1-b673a473a806.description: The Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year recognises a Retirement Village or Retirement Community Manager who creates a successful, happy and harmonious village environment through their exceptional leadership and personal commitment to residents. Entries were shortlisted as finalists for reach region (NSW/ACT, SA/NT, VIC/TAS, WA and QLD).
9093d79e-be13-4de9-b5f1-b673a473a806.name: National Retirement Living Awards 2023 - QLD Regional Winner - Programmed Award for Village Manager of the Year

By entering the National Innovation & Excellence Awards, development project finalists are automatically considered for the State/Territory Development of the Year Award. The development is judged against all other developments in that state/territory and not based on the category entered into the National Awards.
